name: Professor Calvert
detailed_location: Point Lookout LighthouseSt. Aubin medical facility

topics.topic_text: What do you know about Desmond?
topics.response_text: Desmond... That bag of bones and bile will pay dearly for his trespasses!

topics.topic_text: Did you tell the Tribals to attack the mansion?
topics.response_text: Of course I did, but that moron thought it was one of his addled visions. The real goal was to destroy the ghouls' jamming device!

topics.topic_text: How did you come to lead this tribe?
topics.response_text: Jackson believes me to be some kind of god. You'd think that would be good, but his interpretations of my commands leaves something to be desired.

topics.topic_text: Useful? What are you using the tribe for?
topics.response_text: At the moment, they've been no use at all, but I have very few options. They can't even seem to remove a single ghoul from a house.

topics.topic_text: What have you got against the Ghoul?
topics.response_text: More than you could possibly imagine with your squishy pink mind, but the only pressing matter at the moment is a device in his possession.

topics.topic_text: I can't promise anything, but tell me more.
topics.response_text: Excellent. I cannot tell you how satisfying it is to find a suitable assistant after all these years.

topics.topic_text: What the hell are you?
topics.response_text: What you are interacting with is merely a holographic projection. And a rather clumsy one, at that, but it's all I can manage at the moment.

topics.topic_text: Why would I do that?
topics.response_text: He is my enemy! And you will be rewarded!

topics.topic_text: What sort of reward are we talking about here?
topics.response_text: One beyond your imagination! Beyond reckoning! The most amazing gift a living creature can be granted!

topics.topic_text: What is with you two anyway?
topics.response_text: This is a rivalry that has lasted for centuries! You cannot possibly understand with your tiny meaty brain!

topics.topic_text: Fine. I'll do it. Desmond will die.
topics.response_text: EXCELLENT! Destroy him! DESTROY DESMOND!

topics.topic_text: Nah. I think I'll kill you.
topics.response_text: Then you shall die along with him!

topics.topic_text: You both give me a headache. I need to think about it.
topics.response_text: You must decide! Do it now!

topics.topic_text: Or, I could just leave.
topics.response_text: You cannot! The doors are locked! You will remain here until you destroy Desmond!

topics.topic_text: I'm so sick of you. Both of you.
topics.response_text: Your sickness is irrelevant! If you require it, I shall reward you!

topics.topic_text: Why don't you two just talk it over?
topics.response_text: Talking is irrelevant! He must be destroyed!

topics.topic_text: That's right. And what do I get for it?
topics.response_text: I have a very special gift you for, my friend...

topics.topic_text: Oh, you've got to be kidding me.
topics.response_text: Professor Calvert is never kidding!

topics.topic_text: Can't we talk through this?
topics.response_text: You are permitted to talk while you DIE!

topics.topic_text: My dad always said, "Never trust a disembodied brain."
topics.response_text: You would have been wise to listen to him!

topics.topic_text: Now Desmond knows that no one pushes me around.
topics.response_text: Well, I would have expected nothing less from you. And now, I have a very special gift:

topics.topic_text: All in a day's work. Now, share your wisdom with me!
topics.response_text: Indeed, I shall! In fact, I have a very special gift for you, my friend...

topics.topic_text: How about I kill you instead?
topics.response_text: Surely you mean that you will TRY!

topics.topic_text: I'll do it. Desmond will die.
topics.response_text: Yes! At last! EXTERMINATE HIM!

topics.topic_text: I'll let you know when I decide what to do.
topics.response_text: What are you waiting for? Why do you hesitate? DESTROY HIM!

topics.topic_text: That's right. So, what do I get for it?
topics.response_text: Well, for you... I have a very special gift:

topics.topic_text: What? You're betraying me?!
topics.response_text: Betrayal? No no no, betrayal is for lesser men! Your use to me has simply expired.

topics.topic_text: Well, let's do this.
topics.response_text: Ha ha ha ha ha! YES! LET'S!

topics.topic_text: Killing you is going to be more fun than killing Desmond.
topics.response_text: I certainly hope you enjoy your final moments!

topics.topic_text: I guess I should have seen this coming.
topics.response_text: Don't think of it as betrayal. No no no, betrayal is for lesser men! Your use to me has simply expired.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to show Desmond that no one pushes me around.
topics.response_text: Well, I would have expected nothing less from you. And now, I have a very special gift:

topics.topic_text: All in a day's work. Now share your wisdom with me!
topics.response_text: Well, for you... I have a very special gift:

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: What are you waiting for? DESTROY HIM!

conversation.response_text: It is I, Professor Calvert! Don't bother looking around, I'm in your mind!
Excellent! Most excellent! I knew that you would make the right choice.
You fool! What have you done? You will pay for this! PAY!
Come over here, boy. Let's talk.
Ah yes, Mister Lockheart. At last we meet, face to jar. But I'm afraid that at the end of this, it is you who will meet his end.
Yes, Desmond. But whose side is she on? Do you know? Can you be sure? You always were so bad at choosing your allies.
Good! Good... now, come speak with me. We have matters to discuss...
No! How... how could this... be... ...Â ?
Assist me, my robots! I am... under attack!
At last, yes! Desmond will die, and our long struggle will finally end the only way it could have - with me as the victor!
No, not "astral knowledge" you simpleton! Psychic domination! And that still won't be possible until you destroy Desmond's jamming device.
Yes, fine, go destroy the house and its "impurities." Just stop that jammer, and I'll be free of you morons, once and for all!

description:
Professor Calvert is a 220 year-old Caucasian Male.

A brilliant but deranged pre-War scientist and member of the influential Calvert family. Now centuries old, Calvert has merged his consciousness with advanced robotics, becoming a psychic entity capable of holographic projection and mind control. Currently operating from an underground lab beneath the Calvert family mansion, he engages in a bitter rivalry with Desmond Lockheart while manipulating the Point Lookout tribals to do his bidding.

Professor Calvert's Personality: Intelligent, ambitious, manipulative, arrogant, and easily frustrated. Calvert views others as tools to be used in his 'Great Game' against his rival, Desmond Lockheart. He possesses a god complex and is dismissive of those he considers intellectually inferior.

Professor Calvert's Backstory: Born before the Great War, Professor Calvert was an accredited expert in cognitive robotics. He and Desmond Lockheart became bitter rivals in what Lockheart called the 'Great Game' - a competition among global elites to survive and thrive after the apocalypse. When Calvert discovered a project being developed at the St. Aubin medical facility beneath the family mansion, overseen by his brother Senator Calvert, he sought to control it. After the Great War, his consciousness somehow survived and merged with advanced technology, allowing him to exist as a psychic entity. Centuries later, he made contact with Jackson, leader of the Point Lookout tribals, becoming deified as 'the transcendent master' and using them as agents against his rival.
